intro: Arctotis calendula var. hypochondriaca, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers with dark central cones. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, gray-green leaves and a compact, bushy habit. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden borders and rock gardens. The flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, adding a striking visual contrast to the landscape.
